thread.title: Mexicana de Aviación Expands With New Aircraft, Routes
thread.title_full: Mexicana de Aviación Expands With New Aircraft, Routes

title: Mexicana de Aviación Expands With New Aircraft, Routes
text:
Mexicana de Aviación Expands With New Aircraft, Routes
Mexicana de Aviación will acquire 20 new Embraer aircraft between 2025 and 2027, as announced today by Leobardo Ávila Bojórquez, Director General, Mexicana de Aviación, alongside President Claudia Sheinbaum. The airline plans to purchase five planes in 2025, seven in 2026, and eight in 2027. This acquisition will support the company’s expanding fleet and entry into new markets.
In its first year of operations, Mexicana has conducted 7,000 flights across 18 destinations, transporting over 382,000 passengers. The airline has a 90% on-time performance rate, making it the most punctual airline at the Felipe Ángeles International Airport (AIFA).
In 3Q24, Mexicana [experienced](https://www.infobae.com/mexico/2024/12/26/a-un-ano-del-inicio-de-sus-operaciones-mexicana-de-aviacion-presume-mas-de-380-mil-pasajeros/?outputType=amp-type) a 14% increase in operations and a 26% increase in flight kilometers. Additionally, Mexicana has reduced its ticket prices by 20% compared to competitors, offering lower fares to passengers.
Since October 2024, Mexicana has also expanded its cargo operations. In just two and a half months, it has transported over 110,000kg of cargo between AIFA and Tijuana Airport. The airline aims to increase its national cargo market share to 3% by 2030, partnering with AIFA to facilitate this growth.
In 2025, [Mexicana will add new routes](https://www.eleconomista.com.mx/amp/empresas/mexicana-aviacion-comprara-20-aviones-brasilena-embraer-20241226-739708.html) for cargo services to Guadalajara, San Jose, Merida, and Tulum. The most popular passenger routes include Tijuana, Tulum, Merida, Ixtepec, and Ciudad Victoria.
Avila also mentioned that regarding passenger demographics, Mexicana primarily serves people between the ages of 25 and 44, followed by those aged 45 to 64. The gender split is 55% male and 45% female.
